title: Low elos should learn to stop backtalking diamonds
body:
Low elos should learn to stop back talking diamond 1s or higher. If someone from bronze has an opinion that differs from a diamond 1's, the bronzie should NOT try to reason with the high elo. He shouldn't ask why either. He should take what the diamond says as fact without talking back. Too many times, I've seen a bronzie backtalk a diamond 1, and it's disgusting, because the bronzie is wrong most of the time. The only time a bronzie is right is when 500,000 bronzies are talking back to a single diamond 1. There's a reason why you're stuck in bronze. It's because you think differently than the diamonds. Start thinking like a diamond.

Edit: RIP Rackier, you will not be forgotten. This thread is now a memorial to him, so please show respect.

>"Nonsense remains nonsense, even when talked by world-famous scientists."
>-Oxford Dictionary's John Lennox, on the topic of Stephen Hawking trying to prove the trivia of God.

A little backstory for this quote for those who don't know:  in Hawking's book, *The Grand Design*, he argues that :
>"for a law such as gravity to exist, the universe can and will create itself."

To which John Lennox responds:
>"[Hawking's] attempts to explain how, exactly, the big bang emerged from a state of nothingness required an understanding of physics that was beyond me. "If you are not a math head," he concedes far too late in the proceedings, "this may be hard to understand." Indeed.
So, like its alternative, belief in Hawking's premise is an act of faith."

When I see your complaint about "bronzies," being the "worst" players, I think about that first quote.  There is always something more to know; for instance, I thought myself knowledgeable about riven as a riven main a couple years back, but then I learned she could jump walls...
